item.title: Health Secretary Sajid Javid tests positive for Covid
item.description: He says he has had two jabs and so far his symptoms are "very mild" after he felt "groggy" on Friday.

item.title: Covid: Travel firms angry over France quarantine rule
item.description: The continued need for travellers to quarantine on arrival in England, Scotland and Wales is criticised.

item.title: Europe floods: Rescuers race to find survivors as hundreds remain missing
item.description: A senior German politician has been criticised for laughing during a visit to affected areas.

item.title: 'Havana syndrome'-like mystery illness affects Vienna US diplomats
item.description: The Biden administration is investigating cases of so-called "Havana syndrome" among US officials.

item.title: Hottest NI day ever as temperatures soar above 30C
item.description: Ballywatticock near Newtownards records 31.2 degrees, breaking a record set 45 years ago.

item.title: Cannes Film Festival: Titane wins top Palme d'Or prize
item.description: The outlandish Titane wins after jury president Spike Lee reveals the award in a ceremony slip-up.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: 'Heartless' quarantine decision to be re-examined
item.description: Laura Soutar is stuck in hotel isolation in Majorca while her father Iain, from Milngavie, has just days to live.

item.title: Covid: London's Metropolitan Line closed after staff pinged by NHS app
item.description: Control room staff on the Metropolitan Line are isolating after being sent alerts by the NHS app.

item.title: Canada's vaccination rate overtakes US
item.description: Canada had a slow start on vaccinations compared to its neighbour but has now caught up to the US.

item.title: Covid: Sunshine in Wales puts indoor meet-ups on hold
item.description: Groups of six are now allowed to meet in homes - but not many want to be indoors.

item.title: Blackpool councillor 'fat shamed' by MP over critical tweet
item.description: A Blackpool councillor claims a comment one of the town's MPs made in reply to his tweet was "nasty".

item.title: First Covid case reported in Tokyo Olympic village
item.description: The chief of the Tokyo Olympics accepts athletes are "probably very worried", after a Games-related organiser became the first person to test positive for Covid-19 in the athletes' village.

item.title: The Open 2021: Louis Oosthuizen takes one-stroke lead into final day
item.description: Louis Oosthuizen takes a one-stroke lead into the final day of The Open at Royal St George's after holding off Collin Morikawa.

item.title: Farne Islands: Puffins see visitors return after 18 months
item.description: Tourists haven't been able to go to the Farne Islands for 18 months and it's changed the birds' behaviour.

item.title: In pictures: Masks and social distancing at downsized Hajj
item.description: Only about 60,000 pilgrims living in Saudi Arabia were eligible to take part this year.

item.title: Covid vaccine: How are young people responding to the jab?
item.description: The Covid vaccine is now being offered to all over 18s. So what has uptake been like for young people?

item.title: The migrants hunger-striking for legal status in Belgium
item.description: More than 400 go without food demanding a clear path to residency in Belgium.

item.title: Ros Atkins onâ€¦ the North America heat waves
item.description: Ros Atkins explains the link between climate change and recent heat waves in the US and Canada.

item.title: Covid: Coping with opening-up anxiety
item.description: Lauren and Angelica-Jane fear the end of restrictions will be challenging for their mental health.

item.title: Week in pictures: 10 - 16 July 2021
item.description: A selection of powerful images taken around the world this week.

item.title: Amputee's win for prosthetics funding in Wales shows 'people power'
item.description: David Bradley said amputees in Wales had been disadvantaged compared to the rest of the UK.

item.title: Cannes Film Festival 2021 highlights: Sun, stars and saliva
item.description: A-listers flocked to the Cannes Film Festival's red carpet, despite the pandemic.

item.title: Under the skin of OnlyFans
item.description: A BBC investigation reveals concerns about how the site, known for porn, is structured and moderated.

item.title: South Africa Zuma riots: What's behind the violence and looting?
item.description: Some analysts say the violence wasn't spontaneous anger but a deliberate strategy of sabotage.

item.title: Craft beer industry accused of being 'sexist boys' club'
item.description: Independent beer makers have promised reform following allegations of discrimination and harassment.

item.title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: Unvaccinated patients with many regrets
item.description: The number of Covid patients in Bradford Royal Infirmary is rising sharply - and half are unvaccinated.

item.title: Covid-19: Second doses run dry in Brazil's scramble to vaccinate
item.description: Many are struggling to source their second dose of the Covid-19 jab in one of the worst-hit countries.

item.title: 'Travelling fairground life prepared me to be A&E doctor'
item.description: Doctor John Castle says his nomadic childhood helped prepare him for the pressures of the pandemic.

item.title: Why the Scouts are launching a money badge after Covid
item.description: Why Scouts are lending a hand on tackling financial literacy in the wake of the pandemic.

item.title: Stephen Fretwell: 'Gavin and Stacey song equated to a part-time job'
item.description: Stephen Fretwell on his hit TV show theme tune and why his 13-year music hiatus has come to an end.

item.title: Germany floods: How a country was taken by surprise
item.description: Amid the despair and mounting death toll, people are questioning how this could have happened.

item.title: British Grand Prix: 'F1 breaks new ground but jury still out on sprint qualifying'
item.description: F1 broke new ground with the advent of sprint qualifying but uncertainty remains over whether the exercise was a success, writes Andrew Benson.

item.title: Jones returns as Lions thrash Stormers in final warm-up
item.description: The British and Irish Lions complete their Test series preparations with a comfortable win against the Stormers.

item.title: St Helens win Challenge Cup for first time in 13 years - highlights & report
item.description: St Helens come from behind to beat Castleford at Wembley and win the Challenge Cup for the first time in 13 years.

item.title: Pogacar set for Tour de France victory as Van Aert wins penultimate stage
item.description: Tadej Pogacar is set to win the Tour de France after finishing seventh in the time trial on a penultimate stage won by Wout van Aert.

item.title: Jimenez makes long-awaited return and Vieira's Palace win - pre-season round-up
item.description: Raul Jimenez made his long-awaited return from injury as Wolves lost at Crewe, while Palace and Chelsea enjoyed friendly wins

item.title: The Open 2021: Louis Oosthuizen, Collin Morikawa & Jordan Spieth feature in story of day
item.description: Watch highlights as Louis Oosthuizen, Collin Morikawa & Jordan Spieth battle for the top spot on the third day of The Open 2021 at Royal St. George's.

item.title: Challenge Cup final: Castleford Tigers 12-26 St Helens
item.description: Watch highlights as St Helens come from behind to beat Castleford Tigers 26-12 and win the Challenge Cup for the first time in 13 years.

item.title: What are the travel rules for Spain, Portugal, Malta and other holiday hotspots?
item.description: What you need to know about going to Portugal, Spain, Greece, France, Malta, Italy and Turkey.

item.title: 'Covid passports': How can the NHS Covid Pass prove I've had both jabs?
item.description: Clubbers and people attending mass events in England could have to prove they've had both Covid jabs.

item.title: Covid-19: Five ways to avoid catching the virus indoors
item.description: As social distancing restrictions end in England and ease in Scotland, good ventilation remains vital.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid rules: What's changing when restrictions end on 19 July?
item.description: Major changes to lockdown rules take effect in England and Scotland, but some restrictions remain.

item.title: Long Covid: What is it and what are the symptoms?
item.description: New research links as many as 200 different symptoms to the condition.

item.title: The EU vaccine 'passport' and what it means for travel
item.description: An EU vaccine "passport" is being introduced, enabling holders to prove they have been jabbed.

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks will no longer be compulsory in England from 19 July, but will remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Coronavirus cure: What progress are we making on treatments?
item.description: Medical teams around the world are learning which medicines work best against Covid.

item.title: Molesey Lock: Lightning-strike selfie lands siblings in hospital
item.description: Rachel, Isobel and Andrew Jobson were injured as they took the photo during a thunderstorm.

item.title: How your driving might reveal early signs of Alzheimer's
item.description: Research shows how small changes in the way you drive could expose preclinical signs of disease.

item.title: 'Neptune' appears in the waves during storm in Newhaven
item.description: The image resembling the Roman god of water was captured as waves crashed over a harbour wall.

item.title: Couple to participate in every Olympic sport
item.description: The sporting challenge is in memory of Stuart Bates' brother, who died of motor neurone disease.

item.title: Super Mario 64 game sells for record-breaking $1.5m at auction
item.description: An original Zelda cartridge and a Mario game set successive records at auction within days.
